availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hamilton B. Hampton (Booneville, Kentucky, merchant and innkeeper)

body.p: Booneville, Kentucky, merchant and innkeeper. Tennessee native. Married to Rebecca Hampton. Father of Louisa, James, Alexander, Andrew, Joseph P., Emily, Martha, Nancy, and Mary Ada Hampton. Farmer in Lee, Virginia in 1850. Merchant and innkeeper in Booneville, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Lee, District 31, p. 343B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, Booneville, p. 340.
Find A Grave, "Hamilton B. Hampton (1806-1889)," Memorial #106719384, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106719384 (accessed May 21, 2019).
